abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that
            Poverty-focused social service delivery projects should be
            targeted to townships and villages instead of counties.
            Especially at the village primary school level, the design,
            financing, implementation and supervision of rural
            poverty-focused basic education projects, is best handled by
            designated education line ministries and their provincial
            and county sub units. Policy changes and
            institutionalization, such as student assistance programs,
            may be realized when the appropriate survey work is
            conducted first. Caution is advised when provinces and
            counties have to repay IDA or IBRD credits or loans from
            their education budgets. Project management training can
            contribute to the institutionalization of a management
            system when such training occurs throughout the life of a
            project. Student assistance programs in rural China cannot
            be funded solely from interest income on modest trust funds.
            The key issue in developing education projects at the
            provincial, county and township levels is to convince the
            Chinese preparation teams of the importance of focusing on
            development outcomes instead of investment inputs. Forming
            panels of experts with a broad range of skills at the start
            of the targeting exercise is critical to achieving a balance
            that addresses a project's educational, financial and
            staffing needs. Teacher and staff training could have been
            stronger. These programs generally operate according to a
            provincial formula which imitates the national standards.

5081217.trustfund:
TF029401-PHRD-FOURTH BASIC EDUC.PROJ(RECIPIENT-EXEC.),TF022865-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY POLICY &
            PROJECT DEV.,TF029228-PHRD -BASIC EDUC.IN POOR &
            MINOR. AREA (BANK-EXEC),TF033676-CHINA - BASIC EDUCATION IV PROJECT,TF029279-PHRD-FOURTH BASIC EDUC.PROJ.(BANK-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Fourth Basic
            Education Project are: (1) to increase access/equity for the
            absolute poor in primary and junior secondary education,
            paying particular attention to girls and minority
            nationalities; (2) to enhance quality in primary and junior
            secondary schooling, and the corresponding teacher education
            and training of trainers' programs; and and (3) to
            improve efficiency in education delivery through improving
            educational management at national, provincial, county, and
            project institutional levels. The project components are:
            (1) to provide civil works construction, equipment,
            furniture, books and other instructional materials to
            primary and junior secondary schools in poor, minority, and
            remote areas; (2) to upgrade the professional content and
            practical skills of teachers and principals; and (3) to
            train education managers, and develop and utilize
            educational management information services.
